title: Sabaot (1993) Genesis Portion
description: Sabaot (Sebei) is a Kalenjin language of Kenya. The Sabaot people live around Mount Elgon in both Kenya and Uganda. The hills of their homeland gradually rise from an elevation of 5,000 to 14,000 feet. The Kenyaâ€“Uganda border goes straight through the mountain-top, cutting the Sabaot homeland into two halves.
provider: Nairobi, Kenya: Bible Translation and Literacy

language.name: Sabaot
language.area: Western Province, Mt. Elgon District; Rift Valley Province, Trans-Nzoia District.
